evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Gregory's fear of networking events and difficulty explaining his projects and motivations clearly. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Preparing simple openers, practicing 2-3 sentence explanations for projects, and structuring answers to 'why this field' with personal hooks and interests. 3) Student's response to solutions: Gregory initially hesitated but engaged in role-playing and successfully rephrased his project explanation. He also identified specific moments that hooked him into his field. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: Gregory demonstrated improved ability to explain his project in a relatable way and articulated his passion for his field more naturally.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Freezing up at networking events, 2) Difficulty explaining projects and career interests. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Preparing simple openers and focusing on listening, 2) Structuring project explanations with goal, relevance, and interesting aspects, 3) Crafting personal and engaging answers to 'why this field'. Student's response to solutions: Positive, with successful rephrasing of project explanation and crafting a more natural answer about career interests. Evidence of progress/improvement: Student demonstrated ability to simplify technical explanations and create more engaging personal narratives.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Fear of networking events and starting conversations, 2) Difficulty explaining projects and career interests clearly, 3) Anxiety about answering common interview questions. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Preparing simple, genuine openers for networking, 2) Using relatable language and focusing on curiosity over perfection, 3) Structuring answers with personal hooks and genuine interest. Student's response to solutions: Positive, engaged in practice and refined answers. Evidence of progress/improvement: Student shifted from overly technical explanations to relatable language, recognized and adjusted tendency to overcomplicate answers, and expressed increased confidence in handling networking scenarios.
